Justin Kluivert has announced he won't be signing a new contract with Ajax and has accused the club of trying to sell him to Tottenham behind his back.

'I'm not renewing my contract at Ajax,' Kluivert told Volkskrant. 'Too much has happened. The decreasing morale, lack of confidence, trying to sell me to Tottenham without me knowing.

'I heard about that at the last minute. That says nothing about Ajax, but about the people in the club. They do what they want. I get that feeling again: they do what they want.

'My plan was to stay, but a lot has happened lately,' he added. 'The fans think that it's only about money, while everyone knows I had it good. I was not waiting for money at all. Football is important. I want to develop myself.'

CITY PRICED OUT OF BUSQUETS?

Manchester City will not be following up their interest in Sergio Busquets after learning that Barcelona will not allow the midfielder to leave for anything less than his €200m (£174.83m) release clause, according to Marca.

Pep Guardiola and his side apparently "recognise the quality" of the player, but are unwilling to pay such a sum in order to reunite the Spain international with his former boss at the Etihad Stadium.

Ruben Neves told to shun summer transfer amidst Liverpool speculation

Ruben Neves has been told to shun interest from Champions League clubs and stay at Wolves, amidst speculation Liverpool are monitoring his situation.

The Portuguese midfielder was one of the standout players in the Championship this season, leading the Molineux club to 100 points and promotion to the Premier League.


But despite their upward trajectory, the 21-year-old has been linked with a move to a whole host of clubs, including the Reds, although it is believed there is currently no intent to bring the youngster to Anfield.

Former Barcelona man - and compatriot - Deco has implored Neves to reject any advances this summer regardless, and wait for a 'big club' later in his career.

Talisca heading to Premier League, hints Besiktas boss

Amid links to Manchester United and Liverpool, Besiktas coach Senol Gunes suggested Anderson Talisca is heading to the Premier League.

Besiktas coach Senol Gunes hinted Anderson Talisca has agreed a transfer to a Premier League club.

Talisca has spent the last two seasons on loan at Besiktas from Benfica, scoring 27 goals in 55 Super Lig appearances to reportedly draw the interest of Manchester United and Liverpool.

Despite beating Sivasspor 5-1 on Saturday, Gunes' side were unable to defend their Super Lig title as Galatasaray reclaimed the crown with a 1-0 win over Goztepe.

It is to prove Talisca's last outing for Besiktas, with the coach confirming he has already agreed a move to another club.

"Talisca was already gone at the mid-season break," said Gunes.

"I'm sorry that he won't be with us any longer. I wish he could stay for his sake and ours. He already had a deal in place."

The Spain international has enjoyed a fine season, scoring 19 goals in all competitions. Los Che would demand around €60m for the 27-year-old.

VIEIRA NOT GOING TO NICE

Sky Sources understand Patrick Vieira has not signed a deal to become the Nice head coach, contrary to reports in France.

Nice are looking for a new head coach after Lucien Favre confirmed he was leaving last night and is set to move to Borussia Dortmund. Vieira has also been linked with Nantes and Rennes.

He has been managing New York City FC since 2016. Vieira continues to have a very good working relationship with the club’s owners City Football Group and he was contacted by Arsenal last week.

PSG RULE OUT WENGER

Paris Saint-Germain owner Nasser Al-Khelaifi has appeared to rule out Arsene Wenger becoming the club’s sporting director.

In a wide-ranging interview with L’Equipe, Al-Khelaifi said: “He is a close friend, I have a lot of admiration and respect for him and everything he has done in football. He's a big man.

"This is one of the first people I spoke to before buying the club, and he told me one thing that I never forgot: ‘You buy a diamond and it will be cut and shined’. I do not know what he will do, but he will have a lot offers. Today, the sports director (of PSG) is Antero Henrique and he will stay.”

City rejected an offer of £50 million, plus winger Patrick Roberts, who the Citizens valued at £15 million, on transfer deadline day in January, but would have sold Mahrez for £80 million cash.

The Guardian reports that a fee has now been agreed of £60 million cash up front with a further £15 million of add-ons, taking the total of the deal to £75 million.

GARITANO IN AT SOCIEDAD

Real Sociedad have named Asier Garitano as their new head coach.

The 48-year-old Basque has signed a deal tying him to the LaLiga club until June 30, 2021, Sociedad announced on their website.

He replaces Imanol Alguacil, who had been in temporary charge since Eusebio Sacristan was sacked in March. Sociedad finished 12th in LaLiga this season, having been sixth last term.

Garitano had spent the last five years in charge of surprise package Leganes, guiding Los Pepineros from the third tier to the Spanish top flight for the first time in their history.

Under Garitano, Leganes also reached the semi-finals of the Copa del Rey for the first time this year, knocking out neighbours Real Madrid in the process.

negotiations for Paris Saint-Germain rebel Adrien Rabiot, claims Mundo Deportivo newspaper.

The Spanish news reports that Rabiot offered himself to several Serie A and Premier League clubs, including Juventus, along with Barcelona.

The 23-year-old midfielder hit the headlines this week when he wrote a letter to publicly rule himself out of being on stand-by for France’s World Cup squad.

He was aggrieved at not being in the first choice group and preferred to be left out of contention completely.

It’s not the first time Rabiot has been in the news for bad behaviour, as he has in the past criticised club and Coaches for not playing him enough.

His contract is due to expire in June 2019, which could make him relatively affordable this summer.

Rabiot did get 49 competitive appearances for PSG this season, contributing five goals and seven assists.

Juventus and Napoli made “massive” offers for Keita Balde Diao over the last 12 months, revealed Monaco chief Vadim Vasilyev.

The 23-year-old Senegal international was born in Spain and came through the Barcelona youth academy before moving on to Lazio.

“I can confirm we received an offer from Napoli in January that was very high,” Monaco Vice-President Vasilyev told SFR Sport.

“I can also say that I spoke to the Lazio director and he confirmed to me that when we had a basic agreement with Lazio, Juventus tried to intervene with a massive proposal.”

Monaco signed Keita Balde from the Aquile for €30m, a year before his contract was due to expire, in August 2017.

This season, he has contributed eight goals and 11 assists in 33 competitive games.

Agent Mino Raiola refused to comment when asked if Mario Balotelli and Gianluigi Donnarumma could go to Napoli.

The Nice striker is a free agent next month, as his contract with the Ligue 1 side expires, while the Milan goalkeeper has an increasingly tense situation with the fans at San Siro.

The failure to even reach a settlement agreement with UEFA over Financial Fair Play parameters could also force the Rossoneri into a sale.

With Carlo Ancelotti now at the helm, Napoli have changed their transfer strategy and have been linked with both Balotelli and Donnarumma.

Both are represented by Raiola, but when Radio Kiss Kiss Napoli approached the usually talkative agent for comment, he was unusually reticent.

“I won’t talk about this,” he said.

The two players have good reason to favour Napoli, as Balotelli's daughter Pia lives there with his ex girlfriend, while Donnarumma is from the Naples area.

Curiously, Milan have already signed Pepe Reina as a free agent and Napoli are looking for a replacement.

WATFORD WANT DEULOFEU

Watford want to retain the services of on-loan Barcelona winger Gerard Deulofeu, reports Mundo Deportivo.

The Hornets snapped up Deulofeu on loan during the January transfer window and he is set to return to his parent club.

However, they want to keep hold of him and will meet his representatives in the next few days to inform them of their intention to submit a bid to Barcelona.

They also want to confirm that the player is open to the move and find out if he has received offers from elsewhere.

According to Mundo Deportivo, the wideman has told Watford boss Javi Gracia that he is happy to stay at Vicarage Road.

Barca are open to selling the former Everton man, who is out of contract next year.

Exclusive: Chelsea leading Higuain chase, Juve identify Icardi as replacement

Juventus could allow Gonzalo Higuain leave the club, if they receive a right offer this summer and replace him with Inter’s Mauro Icardi, Caliomercato.com understands.

​Gonzalo Higuain arrived in Turin for a fee of €90 million from Napoli two years ago. The goals scored by him are relatively to little less for the investment Juvenus made. The Argentine can now start and is set to move more and more away from Juventus.

Chelsea are already leading the race for Higuain and Juventus believe they can get around €70 million. This will be a good news for Chelsea, especially if they appoint Maurizio Sarri as their new manager. PSG are also interested in Higuain, but Juventus will only allow him leave if they find a replacement.

​Juventus have already made numerous contacts with Icardi’s agent and wife Wanda Nara. The talks have been positive and now have to convince Inter to allow him leave this summer. His release clause €100 million is only for foreign clubs, but there are ways to work around it.

https://www.calciomercato.com/en/news/chelsea-leading-e70m-rated-star-chase-club-identifies-icardi-as--69106

Burnley and Bournemouth are interested in signing West Brom striker Jay Rodriguez, SSN understands, following the Baggies’ relegation from the Premier League.

West Ham and Palace are also keen on the striker, and are monitoring developments, we’ve been told.

Roma want €90m for Alisson
By Football Italia staff

Roma are holding out for at least €90m if they are to sell Alisson Becker to Liverpool or Real Madrid, believing the World Cup will further boost his value.

According to The Guardian, the Giallorossi intend to resist any offers until after Brazil have played in the 2018 tournament.

Alisson is first choice in goal for the Seleçao and expected to further enhance his reputation after helping Roma to the Champions League semi-final and third place in Serie A.

Liverpool are desperate for a new goalkeeper after Loris Karius made two howlers in the 3-1 Champions League Final defeat to Real Madrid.

Curiously, the Merengues are also contenders for Alisson this summer, while Paris Saint-Germain have gone for free agent Gigi Buffon instead.

Alisson is under contract with Roma until June 2021 and currently negotiating an improved deal, as he currently only earns €1.5m per year.

There were reports a €70m proposal was rejected by the Giallorossi.

quote.msg:
Roma want €90m for Alisson
By Football Italia staff

Roma are holding out for at least €90m if they are to sell Alisson Becker to Liverpool or Real Madrid, believing the World Cup will further boost his value.

According to The Guardian, the Giallorossi intend to resist any offers until after Brazil have played in the 2018 tournament.

Alisson is first choice in goal for the Seleçao and expected to further enhance his reputation after helping Roma to the Champions League semi-final and third place in Serie A.

Liverpool are desperate for a new goalkeeper after Loris Karius made two howlers in the 3-1 Champions League Final defeat to Real Madrid.

Curiously, the Merengues are also contenders for Alisson this summer, while Paris Saint-Germain have gone for free agent Gigi Buffon instead.

Alisson is under contract with Roma until June 2021 and currently negotiating an improved deal, as he currently only earns €1.5m per year.

There were reports a €70m proposal was rejected by the Giallorossi.
